citation.comment: Control of vertebrate multiciliogenesis by miR-449 through direct repression of the Delta/Notch pathway.

nanopub.evidence: Our data establish miR-449 microRNAs as key regulators of multiciliogenesis in vertebrates.Mutation of one out of two predicted miR-449-binding sites in the human Notch1 30-UTR, or of two out of three sites in the human Dll1 30-UTR, was sufficient to abrogate the effects of miR-449 in luciferase assays (Fig. 4a).These data indicate that both Dll1 and Notch1 are bona fide targets of miR-449.Importantly, Notch1 protection led to a significant reduction in the number of multiciliated cells, thus phenocopying miR-449 knockdown (Fig. 4f).

citation.comment: Control of vertebrate multiciliogenesis by miR-449 through direct repression of the Delta/Notch pathway.

nanopub.evidence: Conversely,blockade of Notch signalling with a gamma secretase antagonist (DAPT) significantly potentiated multiciliogenesis during HAEC differentiation28,29 (Fig. 4f).

citation.comment: Control of vertebrate multiciliogenesis by miR-449 through direct repression of the Delta/Notch pathway.

nanopub.evidence: Together, our data indicate that direct repression of the Notch pathway by miR-449 is important for multiciliogenesis in HAECs.Furthermore, the deficient multiciliogenesis caused by miR-449 knockdown was efficiently rescued by silencing Dll1 (Fig. 5b,c).

citation.comment: The Rac1 regulator ELMO controls basal body migration and docking in multiciliated cells through interaction with Ezrin.

nanopub.evidence: Morpholino oligonucleotide (MO)-mediated knockdown of Elmo1 or Dock1 led to shortened cilia in the pronephric tubule of 24 hpf embryos (supplementary material Fig. S4B). Transmission electron microscopy (TEM) studies revealed defective basal body transport to the apical membrane in elmo l and dock/ morphants (Fig. IM-0'; supplementary material Fig. S4C). Simultanious knockdown of both rac1 and rac1l revealed a transport defect and an abnormal accumulation of basal bodies in cytoplasm . Rac1 downstream effetctor of ELMO_DOCk1 Increased phospho-ERM (Ezrin) levels were observed in zebrafish embryos depleted of racl/racll, elmo I or dock1(Fig. 7 A), as well as after Rac 1 or Rac JI single knockdown. Reciprocally, overexpression of Elmo 1 or Rac 11 resulted in significantly decreased phospho-ERM levels in zebrafish (Fig. 7B). Ezrin or Elmo 1 overexpression ameliorated the defects caused by elmo I or ezrin depletion, respectively, suggesting that both proteins act in the same pathway that coordinates basal body migration and docking in zebrafish (Fig. 3L).Moreover, injection of mRNA of either ezrin(T564A)mutation or ezrin(T564D) resulted in significantly shortened cilia.

citation.comment: The Rac1 regulator ELMO controls basal body migration and docking in multiciliated cells through interaction with Ezrin.

nanopub.evidence: In Xenopus, combined ELMO 1 and ELM02 knockdown in the medium dose range (each 4 ng) caused defects in the apical migration and membrane attachment of basal bodies, as labelled with Centrin-RFP (Park et al., 2008), and the formation of intracellular polymerized acetylated ce-Tubulin-positive structures (Fig. 2G,H; supplementary material Fig. S6D,E). MO depletion of Racl during Xenopus epidermis development resulted in irregular basal body docking and spacing at the apical membrane (Fig. 6F-H; supplementary material Fig. S7). Downregulation of Ezrin using a translation blocking MO (8 ng) (supplementary material Fig. S8J), led to polymerised acetylated n-Tubulin-positive structures within the cytoplasm that did not project to the outside of the cell like normal ciliary axonemes (Fig. 4A,B; supplementary material Fig. S6D). Strikingly, in ezrin morphants the basal bodies clustered in the cytoplasm close to the cell centre instead of being transported to the apical membrane and distributed uniformly along the cell surface (Fig. 4C-D; supplementary material Fig. S6E).

citation.comment: BMP signalling controls the construction of vertebrate mucociliary epithelia.

nanopub.evidence: BMP MO injection resulted in an increase in the numbers of inner layer cells expressing early markers of MCCs (foxj I and multicilin/M'Cl; Fig. 5A-B') and ionocytes (foxil e; Fig. 5C,C). BMP knockdown also caused a significant expansion of SSCs marked early by foxal (Fig. 50,D') and in stage 35 tadpoles by tphl (Fig. SR and Fig. 6I-J'). We analysed how BMP treatment affected the expression, prior to intercalation, of foxj I, foxi I e and foxa I, which label committed MCCs, ionocytes and SSCs, respectively.As shown in Fig. 3K-M', BMP4 injection at stage 9 resulted in a drastic decrease in the early expression levels of these three markers (foxj I, foxi I e and foxa I), revealing a defect in the specification of inner intercalating cell types.

authors: The mouse homeobox gene Noto regulates node morphogenesis, notochordal ciliogenesis, and left right patterning.
citation.reference: Proc Natl Acad Sci U S A. 2007 Oct 2;104(40):15765-70. Epub 2007 Sep 20.

nanopub.evidence: Expression of the axonemal dynein Dnahc11, which is regulated by Foxj1 in lung epithelial cells (31) and required for cilia motility, was downregulated (Fig 4) and Dnahc5, an axonemal dynein that is expressed in the node and required for the formation of outer dynein arms (43), and Dnchc2, a component of retrograde intraflagellar transport required for normal morpholog (21, 44), were not detected in mutant nodes (Fig 4). In addition, expression of the cytoplasmic dynein Dncl2b in mutant nodes was essentially abolished. Transcripts of Nphp3, encoding a protein that might be involved in microtubule organization and is mutated in Nephronophtisis patients and normally expressed in the node region (45), were significantly downregulated in mutant embryos. Finally, Rfx3, which is required for normal cilia growth (30), was severely downregulated in the node regions of Noto mutant embryos. Collectively, these results establish Noto as a transcription factor upstream of Foxj1 and Rfx3 that is essential for the expression of multiple proteins required for cilia formation and function.

citation.comment: Mutations in CCNO result in congenital mucociliary clearance disorder with reduced generation of multiple motile cilia.
